author: bbecker@thehill.com (Bernie Becker)
title: House Dems push for marriage equality in tax code
text: House Dems push for marriage equality in tax code By Bernie Becker - 07/16/15 01:51 PM EDT Top House Democrats are pushing legislation to put gender-neutral references to marriage into the tax code after the Supreme Court backed same-sex marriage last month. Rep. Sandy Levin (Mich.), the ranking Democrat on the House Ways and Means Committee, introduced the legislation, which is also backed by the top three Democrats in the House: Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi (Calif.), Minority Whip Steny Hoyer (Md.) and Rep. James Clyburn (S.C.). ADVERTISEMENT "As the Supreme Court recently ruled in favor of marriage equality, my bill would effectuate this equality to all married couples under our country's tax code, providing them with the fairness, dignity, and basic rights we all deserve," Levin said in a statement. Senate Finance Committee Chairman Ron Wyden (D-Ore.) introduced the same legislation on the other side of the Capitol last week, with the support of the entire Democratic caucus.
